in yoga it's a very significant part of

which means growth expansion or creation
mojota refers to time or period thus the
period symbolizing creativity or the

mahorta brahma mahuta is considered to

it is one and a half hours before
sunrise generally it is the time between
3 30 am to 6 or 6 30 am the time of
sunrise this time is also called amrit
vela meaning the ambrosial period the

the circadian rhythm the circadian
rhythm is your body's biological clock
that helps all your organs to function
according to your brain's master clock a
large part of this rhythm is determined
by the sleep wake cycle and
environmental cues such as light which
cause the body to wake up a sleep wake
cycle that is aligned with your
circadian rhythm will allow you to enjoy
a restful and restorative sleep however
even a slight disturbance can result in
major problems and diseases waking up in
brahma mahurta will let you stay attuned

clock sending a signal to the brain's
master clock during the brahma mahita
the pineal gland secretes this hormone
at the maximum and waking will help in
stabilizing the sleep cycle the hormone
cortisol which plays a similar role to
an alarm on your body is also released
during this time
tapping into this transition will help

the calculation of brahma mahorta time
depending on your location you can
calculate the exact time of sunrise when
you are in brahma mahorta as stated
earlier the brahma mahorta time is one
hour 36 minutes prior to sunrise however
how has this time been calculated so
precisely the easiest way to understand
the calculation of this precise timing
is in the following way
brahma mahorta starts two muhurtas
before sunrise a mahorta is a hindu unit
of time measurement one mahouta equals
48 minutes to mahuta equals 48 plus 48
equals 96 minutes 96 minutes when
converted into hours and minutes come
out to be one hour and 36 minutes
so if the sunrise at your place is at
6am the brahma mahorta will start at 4
25 am
it is also said that brahma mohorta ends
48 minutes before sunrise
hence the ideal time for doing any
productive and positive activity will be
from 4 25 am to 5 15 am
